The plant typically grows in rocky crevices or on tree trunks in alpine regions, where it thrives in shaded, humid microhabitats. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are arranged in a distinctive pattern along the undersides of its leaves. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, Liponeurum alpinum is considered a vulnerable species in its native habitats.
